areas.name: Area A
areas.description: West of the Capilano River, North of the Trans Canada Highway

areas.name: Area B
areas.description: South of the Trans Canada, West of Capilano Road, extending to approx 200m from the shoreline, or the center of the Lions Gate Bridge (~240m from shore).  Discuss how to handle the marine boundary with the leaders of areas W and Y.

areas.name: Area C
areas.description: North of the Trans Canada Highway between Lynn Creek and the Capilano River.

areas.name: Area D
areas.description: South of the Trans Canada Highway, east from Capilano Rd.  Discuss how to handle marine boundaries with the leaders from the adjoining areas.

areas.name: Area E
areas.description: East from Lynn Creek and the Trans Canada Highway.  North from the midpoint of the Burrard Inlet.  Negotiate how to handle the marine boundary with the leaders of the adjacent areas.

areas.name: Area F
areas.description: East from the Trans Canada Hwy, north from the Lougheed Hwy to the centre of the Burrard Inlet.  Negotiate how to handle the marine boundary with the leaders of areas E and K.  Adrian's paper map extended the outer circle to include all of the Burnaby Mountain golf course and the conservation area up to Centennial Way.  This practice should be continued for the sake of consistency.

areas.name: Area G
areas.description: Between the Lougheed Hwy and Kingsway, mostly east of Boundary Road except for a small bit in the northwest corner of the area which extends to the Trans Canada.

areas.name: Area H
areas.description: North from the midpoint of the Fraser River.  East from Boundary Rd, south from Kingsway.

areas.name: Area I
areas.description: North from the midpoint of the Fraser, including part of Mitchell Island.  South from 41st Ave and from Kingsway. West from Boundary Rd, east from Fraser St.  Discuss how to handle the river boundary with the leader from area V, e.g teams from both areas might want to count along the river at approximately the same time of day.

areas.name: Area J
areas.description: West from Boundary Rd, south from Broadway, north of 41st, east of Fraser except for the northwest corner which extends to Kingsway.

areas.name: Area K
areas.description: North from Broadway, east from Main St, west from Boundary Rd, south from the midpoint of the Burrard Inlet.  Discuss how to handle the marine boundaries with leaders from areas D, L and F.  In particular, it's not clear from the old map how to divide the east end of Crab Park.

areas.name: Area L
areas.description: Downtown east of Denman, plus the False Creek Flats.  Discuss how to handle the many marine boundaries with leaders from the adjacent areas. The boundary in the east end of Crab Park may differ from Adrian's paper maps.

areas.name: Area M
areas.description: East from Granville, north from 41st Ave, west from Fraser and from Kingsway, south from 7th Ave.

areas.name: Area N
areas.description: South from 41st Ave between Granville and Fraser to the midpoint of the Fraser River, including part of Mitchell Island.  Discuss the river boundary with leaders from areas U, T, O and I.

areas.name: Area O
areas.description: South from 33rd between Granville and Camosun to the middle of the Fraser River.  Discuss the river boundary with leaders from areas S, T and N.

areas.name: Area P
areas.description: Discuss how to handle the marine boundary with leaders from areas L, Y and Q.

areas.name: Area Q
areas.description: West from Blanca, north from W 16th Ave.  Discuss the marine boundaries with leaders from areas P, R, S, and Y.

areas.name: Area R
areas.description: Musqueam, university and endowment lands south from W 16th Ave and west from Camosun to somewhere around the midpoint of the Fraser River channel.  Discuss the marine boundary with leaders for areas O, Q and S.

areas.name: Area S
areas.description: Discuss marine boundaries with leaders from adjacent areas.

areas.name: Area T
areas.description: Discuss marine boundaries with leaders from adjoining areas.

areas.name: Area V
areas.description: Richmond east of Number 5 Rd.Counting along the river could be discussed with leaders for areas H, I and U.  For example, it might make sense to try to do the river counts at the same time of day, or to have someone from the adjoining area count portions of the river that aren't accessible from within the designated area.

areas.name: Area W
areas.description: West of the Stanley Park Causeway, North of Denman.  Marine boundary extends to approx 200m offshore: negotiate with leaders of areas B, Y, L and P how to handle the marine boundaries.

areas.name: Area X
areas.description: North and east from the Stanley Park Causeway to the middle of the Burrard Inlet.  Discuss the marine boundaries with the leaders from areas W, B, D and L.

areas.name: Area Y
areas.description: This area is counted from one or more boats.  The area Y leader needs to discuss  with the adjoining area leaders how to handle counting along the boundaries.
